Address6

lib/ipv6.js

Represents an IPv6 address

new Address6(address: string, groups: number)
Parameters
address (string) An IPv6 address string
groups (number = 8) How many octets to parse
Example
var address = new Address6('2001::/32');
Static Members
▸ fromBigInteger(bigInteger)
lib/ipv6.js

Convert a BigInteger to a v6 address object

fromBigInteger(bigInteger: BigInteger): Address6
Parameters
bigInteger (BigInteger) a BigInteger to convert
Returns
Address6:
Example
var bigInteger = new BigInteger('1000000000000');
var address = Address6.fromBigInteger(bigInteger);
address.correctForm(); // '::e8:d4a5:1000'
▸ fromURL(url)
lib/ipv6.js

Convert a URL (with optional port number) to an address object

fromURL(url: string): Address6
Parameters
url (string) a URL with optional port number
Returns
Address6:
Example
var addressAndPort = Address6.fromURL('http://[ffff::]:8080/foo/');
addressAndPort.address.correctForm(); // 'ffff::'
addressAndPort.port; // 8080
▸ fromAddress4(address4, address)
lib/ipv6.js

Create an IPv6-mapped address given an IPv4 address

fromAddress4(address4: any, address: string): Address6
Parameters
address4 (any)
address (string) An IPv4 address string
Returns
Address6:
Example
var address = Address6.fromAddress4('192.168.0.1');
address.correctForm(); // '::ffff:c0a8:1'
address.to4in6(); // '::ffff:192.168.0.1'
▸ fromArpa(arpaFormAddress)
lib/ipv6.js

Return an address from ip6.arpa form

fromArpa(arpaFormAddress: string): Adress6
Parameters
arpaFormAddress (string) an 'ip6.arpa' form address
Returns
Adress6:
Example
var address = Address6.fromArpa(e.f.f.f.3.c.2.6.f.f.f.e.6.6.8.e.1.0.6.7.9.4.e.c.0.0.0.0.1.0.0.2.ip6.arpa.)
address.correctForm(); // '2001:0:ce49:7601:e866:efff:62c3:fffe'

▸ binaryZeroPad()
lib/ipv6.js

Return a zero-padded base-2 string representation of the address

binaryZeroPad(): String
Returns
String:
Example
var address = new Address6('2001:4860:4001:803::1011');
address.binaryZeroPad();
// '0010000000000001010010000110000001000000000000010000100000000011
//  0000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000001000000010001'

▸ to4()
lib/ipv6.js

Return the last two groups of this address as an IPv4 address string

to4(): String
Returns
String:
Example
var address = new Address6('2001:4860:4001::1825:bf11');
address.to4(); // '24.37.191.17'
